abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            unsatisfactory, but evaluation of the level of achievement
            of project objectives is highly judgmental since the
            original project design did not include monitoring
            indicators and mechanisms to measure project performance.
            Also, the three development objectives are too general to
            accurately assess the project's contribution. Overall
            project sustainability is rated unlikely as none of the
            activities started under the project are viable toaday
            without significant government support. World Bank
            performance is overall rated marginally satisfactory, while
            Borrower participation is rated unsatisfactory. Lessons
            learned concerned the issues of including the main
            stakeholders and beneficiaries while garnering government
            commitment; recognizing the political nature of health
            reform as a political risk; ensuring that the government
            enacts a long-term strategy for the project subcomponents to
            feed into; avoiding having too many consultants while
            increasing the involvement of the health ministry's own
            staff; allocating sufficient money for the purposes
            envisaged; making sure that the technical staff of the PMU
            conducts its business in a transparent way and that this is
            well communicated to the outside world; communicating with
            the media and other stakeholders to explain what we do and
            how we work so that new governments have a more accurate
            idea as to how we function; and reducing the complexity of
            the project design to reduce project risk.
